title: Sputnik 1 Launched
overview: The Soviet Union launches Sputnik 1, the first artificial Earth satellite, marking the beginning of the space age and satellite communications.

title: Apollo 11 Moon Landing
overview: NASA’s Apollo 11 mission successfully lands Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin on the Moon, achieving a historic milestone in space exploration.

title: Voyager 1 Launch
overview: NASA launches Voyager 1 to study the outer Solar System; it later becomes the most distant human-made object in space, still transmitting data.

title: Hubble Space Telescope
overview: The Hubble Space Telescope is launched, providing unprecedented images of deep space and revolutionizing astronomy.

title: International Space Station Assembly Begins
overview: Construction of the International Space Station (ISS) begins, becoming a permanent multinational research lab in orbit.

title: SpaceX Falcon 1 Reaches Orbit
overview: SpaceX becomes the first private company to launch a liquid-fueled rocket into orbit with Falcon 1, paving the way for private spaceflight.

title: Falcon 9 Maiden Flight
overview: SpaceX launches Falcon 9, designed for reusability and payload to ISS. It becomes one of the most important rockets of the 21st century.

title: Dragon Docks with ISS
overview: SpaceX’s Dragon spacecraft becomes the first commercial vehicle to deliver cargo to the International Space Station.

title: Falcon 9 First Stage Landing
overview: SpaceX successfully lands the first stage of Falcon 9, proving rocket reusability and dramatically lowering launch costs.

title: Falcon Heavy Demo Flight
overview: SpaceX launches Falcon Heavy, the most powerful operational rocket, carrying a Tesla Roadster into space as a test payload.

title: Starlink Constellation Begins
overview: SpaceX begins deploying its Starlink satellite constellation, creating the world’s largest LEO network for global Internet service.

title: Crew Dragon Demo-2
overview: SpaceX’s Crew Dragon carries NASA astronauts to the ISS, marking the first crewed orbital flight by a private company.

title: Mars Rover Perseverance & Ingenuity Helicopter
overview: NASA lands Perseverance rover and Ingenuity helicopter on Mars, achieving the first powered flight on another planet.

title: James Webb Space Telescope
overview: NASA and ESA launch the James Webb Space Telescope, the most advanced space observatory, designed to peer into the early universe.

title: Starship Test Flights
overview: SpaceX begins test flights of Starship, a fully reusable heavy-lift rocket designed for Mars colonization and interplanetary travel.
